cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing WNW across the northern Leeward Islands, then forecast to bend northwest toward the Bahamas and South Florida before moving up the Florida peninsula

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for U.S. coast as of Advisory 28
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for U.S. coast as of Advisory 28
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula including the northeast Florida coast and adjacent Georgia coast
weather_observation.wind: Low but increasing chance (up to 9%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds by late Sunday–Monday; strongest winds would be Monday if the core tracks inland up the peninsula.
weather_observation.storm_surge: If the center tracks up the east coast or just inland, onshore flow could push 3–5 ft of surge into the lower St. Johns River and adjacent beaches.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 4–8 inches of rain Monday–Tuesday with locally higher totals, producing urban and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough surf and dangerous rip currents beginning this weekend could halt pilot boarding and small-craft traffic.
